alert.note: Alert for DeSoto (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 4:07AM CST until January 03 at 11:00AM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH CONTINUES THROUGH EARLY THIS MORNING... .Heavy rainfall continues across much of the Mid-South this morning. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... The Flood Watch continues for * Portions of East Arkansas, North Mississippi, Southeast Missouri, and West Tennessee, including the following areas, in East Arkansas, Clay, Craighead, Crittenden, Cross, Greene, Lee, Mississippi, Phillips, Poinsett, and St. Francis. In North Mississippi, Coahoma, DeSoto, Marshall, Panola, Quitman, Tate, and Tunica. In Southeast Missouri, Dunklin and Pemiscot. In West Tennessee, Crockett, Dyer, Fayette, Gibson, Haywood, Henry, Lake, Lauderdale, Obion, Shelby, Tipton, and Weakley. * Until 6 AM CST early this morning * WHEN...Through early tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
